intro: Memora glaberrima, commonly known as the smoothleaf memora, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in wetlands and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soil. Memora glaberrima is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and aesthetic value.
